name: Blind Mouths Eat T-Shirt
description:
*PRE-ORDER NOW*

We are doing a very limited run of screen printed t-shirts of the new artwork for The Doomed Bird of Providence's Blind Mouths Eat.

Pre-order now - orders will be shipped in December.

Gildan heavy cotton black t-shirts, screen printed with water based inks.

Sizes:

Men's S/M/L/XL/XXL
Women's S/M/L

(image is for illustration - full t-shirts will be hand screen printed, so will look stunning but each will be unique in finish)

name: The Doomed Bird of Providence - Blind Mouths Eat
description:
*OUT NOW AND IN STOCK*

Limited first edition of 250.

Blind Mouths Eat is the 2nd album by The Doomed Bird of Providence. Continuing an exploration into the darkest regions of Australian colonial history the album takes the style and content of their first long player (Will Ever Pray) into a more violent, death ridden landscape supported by a more eclectic and experimental approach to song writing, and featuring an extended line-up including Katie English aka Isnaj Dui.

name: The Outer Church T-Shirt
description: Previously AVAILABLE EXCLUSIVELY at the compilation launch events - the remaining tees are now for sale only from here, and there are ONLY A FEW LEFT. Get 'em while you can... **Now printing a few more - order below** Gildan heavy cotton black t-shirts, screen printed with water based inks. Limited edition of 50. Sizes: Men's S/M/L/XL Women's S/M/L (not all now available) **NOTE: A t-shirt orders will be sent out ASAP, though will be following the release of the album on 5th August.

name: Various Artists - The Outer Church (2nd Edition)
description:
**2ND EDITION SOLD OUT HERE - order via bandcamp or other online stores**

Following the first edition selling out, we are now re-pressing The Outer Church compilation. The second edition comes in a gatefold double CD sleeve, with poster insert featuring artwork by Alexander Tucker.

Front & Follow present a collaboration with the UK’s foremost uncanny audiovisual event, The Outer Church. Chief programmer Joseph Stannard has compiled a stunning 28-track double album of all-new previously unreleased material from a host of incredible conspirators.

The artists list in full: 

Embla Quickbeam / Grumbling Fur / Some Truths / Kemper Norton / Pye Corner Audio / Black Mountain Transmitter / Angkorwat / Position Normal / Ekoplekz / BrokenThree / Anna Meredith / Hong Kong In The 60s / Baron Mordant & Mr Maxted / Graham Reznick / Old Apparatus / VHS Head / The Wyrding Module / Silver Pyre / These Feathers Have Plumes / Hacker Farm / Robin The Fog / Vindicatrix / Wrong Signals / Sone Institute / Tidal / Paper Dollhouse / Time Attendant / IX Tab.

Joseph writes:

“Wind the tape all the way back to Brighton in 2009. The uncanny influence seeping into contemporary music from ‘elsewhere’ had become impossible to ignore. Magazine pieces I had written in my capacity as a music critic were revealed to contain subliminal memos for my own attention. Unusually vivid dreams and unsettling anonymous telephone calls imparted curious instructions. I was to establish a space in which various forms of unheimlich audio would converge with moving images of a similarly anomalous nature. Equipped only with a well-thumbed copy of The Beginner’s Guide To Psychic Architecture, I resolved to build a Church.

“This compilation presents a selection of the artists who have performed at The Outer Church, with the exception of illustrious filmmaker and composer Graham Reznick, who lives in faraway Brooklyn and kindly permitted us to screen his tremendous psychedelic campfire tale, I Can See You, in Brighton and Dublin. All of the recordings here are previously unreleased. Together they advance the argument that something weird is stirring in modern music which resists categorisation, manifesting itself in unsettling cadences and temporal distortions across a wide variety of occult strategies.”

The Outer Church was established in 2009 by music writer Joseph Stannard (The Wire, Mojo, The Quietus). Since then it has brought the finest in uncanny film and music to Brighton, including live sets from Demdike Stare, Raime, Pye Corner Audio, Old Apparatus, Moon Wiring Club and The Haxan Cloak plus screenings of new independent films such as I Can See You, Die Farbe and Overhill.

name: Collision/Detection - 1st Edition Box Set + bonus download
description:
**OUT NOW!**

2xCD Box Set - Limited 1st Edition in letter press package.

Collision/Detection is the second experimental audio project from Long Division with Remainders (LDWR) which sees invited artists submit audio clips into a central pot, which is then distributed around the group for them to do with as they see fit, resulting in a series of digital EPs released across 2012 and 2013. 

These EPs are now collected together for this 2 CD box set, presented in a bespoke package, letter pressed by Red Plate Press (www.redplatepress.tumblr.com) with artwork from Paul Loudon (www.paulloudon.com). 

The limited first edition also includes a bonus digital album containing new tracks by Collision/Detection contributors and the original sound clips which started the series (if you order from our shop, we will email a download code to you).

EPs come from Psychological Strategy Board (Jonny Mugwump and Time Attendant), West Norwood Cassette Library, The Lord, Hong Kong in the 60s, BLK TAG, Kemper Norton, The Doomed Bird of Providence, Isnaj Dui and Sone Institute.

Digital downloads of all the EPs are available from all the usual places (Boomkat, iTunes, Amazon etc).  The bonus audio download is EXCLUSIVE to the CD Box Set only.

name: Sone Institute - A Model Life
description:
A Model Life brings Roman Bezdyk’s unique and ambitious style out to play again with instantly familiar loops, mid-bar trips and assorted quirk. Witchcraft and Pornography, the opening track to the album, sets off with an echolalic electric guitar riff, like Hendrix on a merry-go-round, while M’Ling introduces a spaghetti western-esque snippet that repeats catchily, like an over-caffeinated ear worm. 

Sone Institute offers a soundtrack to a world that doesn’t exist (and perhaps shouldn’t), as in The World is a Confusion, where 80’s electronic beats and honking psychodrama intermingle with a vocal that makes sure we know: ‘the world is confusion, a spiral drawn in the sand…’ 

Where Curious Memories delved into the sonic toy box with toddler like glee, A Model Life uses Bezdyk’s highly skilled audio juggling to sure footed effect with an album that also shows off attention span and subtlety in spades.

The album features a host of guest appearances including Nils Frahm, Dale Grundle (The Sleeping Years/Catchers) and Katie English (Isnaj Dui).  The stunning artwork is by Nick Cobb, from his photo series ‘The Car Park’. 

‘A Model Life’ follows Sone Institute’s 2010 debut, Curious Memories, and his collaboration with Dollboy - The Sum and The Difference.  He is currently taking part in the Long Division with Remainders ‘Collision/Detection’ audio series (released on Front & Follow), along with Hong Kong in the 60s, West Norwood Cassette Library, The Doomed Bird of Providence and many more, and will be touring in the autumn.

www.frontandfollow.com
www.soneinstitute.co.uk

name: Sone Institute - all 3 releases for £20
description:
Buy all 3 Sone Institute releases for a special price - v. limited.

Curious Memories - debut album (limited edition CD)
The Sum and The Difference - collaboration with Dollboy (limited edition mini CD)
A Model Life - the new album (limited edition CD)

A Model Life: Released Monday 10th Sept - PRE-ORDER NOW

A Model Life brings Roman Bezdyk’s unique and ambitious style out to play again with instantly familiar loops, mid-bar trips and assorted quirk. Witchcraft and Pornography, the opening track to the album, sets off with an echolalic electric guitar riff, like Hendrix on a merry-go-round, while M’Ling introduces a spaghetti western-esque snippet that repeats catchily, like an over-caffeinated ear worm. 

Sone Institute offers a soundtrack to a world that doesn’t exist (and perhaps shouldn’t), as in The World is a Confusion, where 80’s electronic beats and honking psychodrama intermingle with a vocal that makes sure we know: ‘the world is confusion, a spiral drawn in the sand…’ 

Where Curious Memories delved into the sonic toy box with toddler like glee, A Model Life uses Bezdyk’s highly skilled audio juggling to sure footed effect with an album that also shows off attention span and subtlety in spades.

The album features a host of guest appearances including Nil Frahm, Dale Grundle (The Sleeping Years/Catchers) and Katie Inglish (Isnaj Dui).  The stunning artwork is by Nick Cobb, from his photo series ‘The Car Park’. 

‘A Model Life’ follows Sone Institute’s 2010 debut, Curious Memories, and his collaboration with Dollboy - The Sum and The Difference.  He is currently taking part in the Long Division with Remainders ‘Collision/Detection’ audio series (released on Front & Follow), along with Hong Kong in the 60s, West Norwood Cassette Library, The Doomed Bird of Providence and many more, and will be touring in the autumn.

www.frontandfollow.com
www.soneinstitute.co.uk

name: The Doomed Bird of Providence - The Bell of the Jardines
description:
Bespoke mini CD package by Damian O'Hara. Limited edition of 50.

Front & Follow presents the new single from The Doomed Bird of Providence, featuring two brand new tracks.

The Bell of the Jardines tells the strange and ill-fated tale of Frank Jardine who took his brother and his wife, a Samoan princess he had abducted, 1000 miles across rough terrain to Somerset in North East Australia. His plan was to develop Somerset into a port and to this end he used an old ship's bell to attract ships travelling down the coast, but all his ambitions were thwarted by leprosy, which killed him and his wife.

The Death Flurry is a live favourite bringing a full blooded performance from singer Mark Kluzek and now recorded for the first time. Its inspiration lies in a song by Scottish-Australian singer Harry Robertson and the painting The Death Flurry by Oswald W. Brierly. The song, a slow but visceral arrangement with a single solemn hand drum running through, invokes the terror of the early whaling exploits of Norfolk Islanders who set out to risk a watery grave for the prize of 'the king of the sea'.

Digital download available from iTunes, amazon, eMusic, Boomkat etc.

name: BLK w/BEAR / Yonokiero combo
description:
BLK w/BEAR - Sorry about your (remixes) & Yonokiero - Blue Apples.

BLK w/BEAR's latest release features 4 remixes of Yonokiero's Blue Apples.

Blue Apples is the debut album from Nottingham duo Yonokiero, originally released in 2009.

Buy both together in v. limited edition packaging for only a tenner.  Lovely. 

More info here - http://www.frontandfollow.com

Please note the BLK w/BEAR release is a black finish CDR.

name: BLK w/BEAR - Sorry about your (remixes)
description: **OUT NOW** Front & Follow releases a new selection of experimental interpretations of the Yonokiero album Blue Apples by BLK w/BEAR, known for their work on Mark Beazley's Trace Recordings, our own Long Division with Remainders and as a cornerstone of the Washington DC alternative art scene. BLK w/BEAR sound like The Books drank a bunch of cough syrup and morphed to look exactly like Peter Brotzmann' - Isaac Linder, 2005 '...like Basic Channel at their most abstract, and after a severe nervous breakdown' - Wire Magazine, 2010 'The sound of things falling apart' - Cohort Records, 2011 Original sound files are reconfigured and fragments of melody and lyrics are rearranged to accentuate audio decay and broken communications: the melancholy keyboard line from “Sumimasen” is in place sublimated by Morse Code; the Blues-shuffle of “Casey Jnr” is bathed in whispered vocalisations and sombre clarinet tones that punctuate looping cello and percussion. “Blue Apples” is reanimated as both the deep-drone “BLK Apples” and a second reconstruction wherein the original track’s acoustic jaunt is slowed to a snail’s pace of skittering prepared vinyl rhythms, ghostly vocals and the guitar processed to recall instead a samisen.

name: F&F010: The Doomed Bird of Providence - Will Ever Pray
description: *Now sold out here - a few copies with the band at shows, and in shops. Debut album from The Doomed Bird of Providence - a meticulous creation cleaved from original historical source material, bringing to visceral life the forgotten stories of Australia's earliest days, bathed in salt, blood and dark-deeds. CD limited to 250 copies (full CD, not CDR), with artwork artwork by Paul Loudon, design and layout by Damian O'Hara. Artwork screenprinted in Manchester onto card sleeve and double-sided newspaper-style poster by one69a. This is a very very special package, a real work of art. Please look at the photos here and on the screen printers website (click HERE). More info at the website HERE.

name: Doomed Bird: Will Ever Pray T-shirt (ltd edition)
description: Art by Paul Loudon, design by Damian O'Hara and screenprinted in Manchester by one69a. T-shirts are dark grey, with white printing, and are organic and fair trade. More information about the release can be found at the website HERE

name: Sone Institute combo for £10
description:
Get Sone Institute's Curious Memories (A minor classic of modern British Electronica) and The Sum and The Difference by Dollboy Meets Sone Institute together for only £10.

Available for a limited time only.

Curious Memories comes in bespoke packaging, featuring embroidered patch mounted on grey board.

The Sum and The Difference comes in limited edition mini-CD package.

name: 3 for £15 (Elite Barbarian, Yonokiero & Sone Institute)
description:
Buy 3 of our releases together for the bargain price of £15!

Sone Institute - Curious Memories (F&F004)
Yonokiero - Blue Apples (F&F002)
Elite Barbarian - It's Only When You Get To The End That It All Makes Sense (F&F001)

All in bespoke, limited edition packaging.

name: 2 for £10 (Elite Barbarian & Yonokiero)
description:
Buy the Elite Barbarian and Yonokiero albums together for only £10!

With full bespoke, limited edition packaging.

name: F&F009: Dollboy Meets Sone Institute - The Sum and The Difference
description: The Sum and The Difference is a home spun collection of hazy acoustic tunes and electronic interventions from Sone Institute and Dollboy. Existing material from each artist was swapped, reworked / re-imagined by the other to create a collection of miniatures. It has has been designed to flow as one 17 minute piece while retaining the individual character of each of the seven songs. The mini-album will be available on limited edition mini-CD and digital download. Preview the whole release on soundcloud HERE

name: F&F004: Sone Insitute - Curious Memories
description: Sone Institute is the weird and wonderful world of electronic artist Roman Bezdyk. Spinning together found sounds, classroom percussion and a host of stringed instruments, Sone Institute is a surreal and fantastical world of pure sonic imagination. “a disorientation which oscillates uneasily between bliss and vertigo” – Wire “Curious Memories will definitely surprise, enthral and confuse you in equal measures. It’s the work of a man with no obvious musical agenda other than to seemingly make something truly different and original.” – Subba Cultcha In all good records shops (distributed by Cargo), and to digitally download from iTunes, eMusic, Amazon etc (distributed by State 51) Hear samples at the F&F myspace

name: F&F002: Yonokiero - Blue Apples
description: Debut album from the two men behind legendary Hirameka Hi-Fi, which takes them in an altogether different direction. "Instead ’blue apples’ - incidentally comprising of a dozen softly teased idyllic nuggets - reveals a more considered and thoughtful side to the collective persona of HHF and hitherto confirms what most of us have long known for some time now that being the chemistry that exists between Baldwin and Coogan." Losing Today Also available to download digital from iTunes, eMusic, Amazon etc. *Due for re-release on CD in Summer 2010 Hear samples at the F&F myspace

name: F&F001: Elite Barbarian - Its Only When...
description: Debut album from Elite Barbarian aka Ben Page (Rockernumbernine) and Michael Donnelly - 'It's Only When You Get To The End That It All Makes Sense' "Recommended if you enjoy laboratory electronica from acts like Mr. 76ix, Team Doyobi, Lego Feet, and Metamatics." - Headphone Commute OUT NOW in all good records shops (distributed by Cargo) Also available to download digital from iTunes, eMusic, Amazon etc. Hear samples at the F&F myspace

name: F&F003: Andy Nice - The Secrets of Me
description: Debut album from Andy Nice, cellist with Tindersticks. "Delightful, dark and ambient" - Record Collector **Back in stock - a few copies left have come our way, snap them up while you can. You can get Andy's album through our distributor Cargo - in all good record shops, online (e.g. at Amazon) plus download digitally via iTunes, eMusic, Amazon etc. Andy has some copies with him for the Tindersticks tours too... Hear samples at the F&F myspace

name: F&F007: Long Division with Remainders
description: UPDATE - SOLD OUT HERE, BUT A FEW LEFT AT NORMAN RECORDS Very very limited copies now left at Norman Records HERE** LDWR's first collection features 52 tracks of music across 4 CDs, with EPs from artists across the US, Europe and Australia including Leyland Kirby, Isnaj Dui, BLK w/BEAR and Sone Institute. With packaging by the wonderful Damian O'Hara (www.damianohara.com), the first edition is ONLY 100 COPIES (and selling very quickly...). More information about LDWR can be found at the www.ldwr.net

name: LDWR T-shirt (ltd edition)
description: Very limited edition organic LDWR t-shirt, designed by Damian O'Hara, featuring the poster design from Long Division with Remainders box set. There are a small number (literally a handful) in limited sizes available to buy - get in quick!

name: F&F012: LDWR Wrapping Paper!
description: Very very limited wrapping paper, screen printed by one69a exclusively for the Grotto shop in Manchester (more info HERE
